column4: could anyone give me a hint why the NVidia support doesn't work at my Ubuntu?
how did you install the driver?
sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx et al.
what does glxinfo | grep direct give you?
direct rendering: Yes
well technically you are hardware accelerated!
I know, and that's the weird part! Depending on the moon phase it works or it doesn't!
could that be a hardware problem?
what card do you have?
I have a very similar card and it worked for me. Did you actually try a 3d game>
and it works well in windows?
I have no windows
did you connect the power cable?
I'm sorry, was that a serious question?
well I forgot it once!
I'm going to turn this off and check for loosely plugged cards
3d doesn't work?
I moved the NVidia to a windows PC, and it works fine, so it's not a hardware problem (at least not with the card)
now I'm trying an ATI
desrt: AHA!
really? wow I have a FX 5900XT which is almost the same as yours and have had no problems
I'm afraid it's a motherboard problem
FireGL is about 1.5 years old now, I think
